abstract: South Carolina's legislature is set to consider bipartisan proposal to remove Confederate flag from grounds of State House; proposal, prompted by killings at Emanuel AME Church in Charleston, is likely to pass, but emotional debate is expected in both State Senate and House.
lead_paragraph: The General Assembly is expected on Monday to begin considering a bipartisan proposal to remove the Confederate battle flag from the grounds of the State House.

headline.main: South Carolina Legislators Gird for Confederate Flag Debate
headline.print_headline: Debate Over Confederate Flag Is Set to Move Inside South Carolina’s Capitol

snippet: The General Assembly is expected on Monday to begin considering a bipartisan proposal to remove the Confederate battle flag from the grounds of the State House.
